title: Female Restaurant Manager Job at Apex Forte Professionals
content:
Apex Forte Professionals is a company specializing in providing recruitment and staffing solutions. Their primary objective is to connect highly skilled professionals with organizations that need their expertise, ensuring a good match between the candidates' skills and the clients' requirements. This involves a range of services, including talent acquisition, workforce management, and consulting to help businesses build effective teams and achieve their goals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Restaurant Manager

Job Location: Opebi - Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities

	Supervise day-to-day restaurant operations to ensure a smooth and efficient service.

title: IT Administrator Job at Fortis Global Insurance Plc
content:
Fortis Global Insurance Plc. ’FGI’ is a dynamic and innovative force poised to redefine the insurance landscape in Nigeria. We are driven by a singular vision: to deliver unparalleled value and a seamless experience to every customer.

At FGI, we believe the future of insurance is intelligent, intuitive, and deeply personal. We are built from the ground up as a technology-driven enterprise, leveraging cutting-edge solutions to simplify complex processes, enhance accessibility, and provide swift, reliable service. Our digital-first approach ensures that managing the insurance needs of our clients is effortless, secure, and always at their fingertips.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Administrator

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The IT Administrator is responsible for ensuring the robust, secure, and compliant operation of all IT infrastructure, systems, and networks.
	This position is vital for supporting seamless policy issuance, claims processing, customer interactions, and back-office operations.
	The IT Administrator will not only provide essential technical support but also proactively manage IT assets and contribute to strategies that enhance the reliability, security, and performance of the technology used in the organisation.


Key Responsibilities
System and Network Administration for Core Underwriting Operations:


	Install, configure, maintain, and troubleshoot server hardware and software (Windows Server, Linux, and virtualization platforms like VMware/Hyper-V).
	Manage and monitor network infrastructure (routers, switches, firewalls, Wi-Fi access points) ensuring high availability for internal users and external policyholders/partners.
	Implement and maintain secure network configurations, including VPNs for remote access for agents and staff, and robust access controls.
	Administer and maintain cloud-based services (e.g., Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, specialized insurance SaaS platforms, AWS, Azure) ensuring optimal performance and integration.
	Perform regular, verified system backups and ensure comprehensive data recovery procedures are in place and tested to safeguard sensitive customer and policy data.


Specialized Application Support & Integration:


	Provide technical support for software applications (e.g., policy administration systems, claims management systems, CRM platforms, actuarial software).
	Assist with the integration of new insurance-specific tools and platforms.
	Troubleshoot issues related to data flow between various systems.


User Support and Helpdesk Management:


	Provide technical support to end-users (underwriters, claims adjusters, agents, customer service) for hardware, software, and network issues, understanding their specific workflows.
	Diagnose and resolve technical problems efficiently, minimising downtime for operations.
	Manage helpdesk tickets, prioritising issues based on business impact (e.g., claims processing urgency).
	Onboard and off-board employees, including setting up application access, equipment, and compliance-driven permissions.


Hardware and Software Lifecycle Management:


	Procure, deploy, and maintain IT equipment (desktops, laptops, mobile devices, biometric scanners, specialized printers).
	Install, update, and manage software applications and licenses, ensuring compliance with vendor agreements.
	Maintain an accurate inventory of IT assets, including software licenses and subscriptions.


Information Security & Regulatory Compliance:


	Implement and enforce strict IT security policies and best practices aligned with financial services and data privacy regulations (e.g., NDPR, NAICOM GUidelines etc).
	Proactively monitor systems for security breaches, fraud attempts, and unauthorized access, and respond to incidents promptly.
	Ensure compliance with relevant industry-specific regulations and internal security standards related to customer data (e.g., Personally Identifiable Information - PII).
	Conduct regular vulnerability assessments and implement remediation plans to protect sensitive policyholder data.


Documentation and Reporting:


	Maintain comprehensive documentation of IT systems, configurations, network diagrams, and operational procedures, with emphasis on compliance-related records.
	Generate reports on system performance, security incidents, compliance adherence, and user support metrics.
	Document solutions for insurance-specific application issues to enhance the knowledge base.


IT Project Participation & Strategic Input:


	Assist in the planning, implementation, and deployment of new IT projects that directly support product development, customer service enhancements, or operational efficiency.
	Evaluate new technologies and recommend solutions to improve IT efficiency and effectiveness within an insurance context.
	Collaborate with business units (Underwriting, Claims, Sales) to understand their evolving IT needs and provide tailored solutions.


Qualifications


	Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
	Experience: 5 -7 years of experience in IT administration, network administration, ideally within the financial services or insurance industry.


Technical Skills:


	Strong knowledge of Windows Server operating systems and Active Directory.
	Expertise with network protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP) and network hardware (routers, switches, firewalls).
	Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, AWS, Azure).
	Proficiency in troubleshooting hardware and software issues for desktops, laptops, and mobile devices.
	Demonstrable understanding of cybersecurity principles, data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, local data protection laws), and compliance best practices in financial services.
	(Optional) Experience with virtualization technologies (VMware, Hyper-V).
	(Optional) Familiarity with Linux operating systems.
	(Highly Desirable) Exposure to or experience with core insurance software platforms (e.g., policy administration, claims, CRM for insurance).


Soft Skills:


	Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, with a keen eye for security vulnerabilities.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills, capable of translating technical concepts to non-technical insurance professionals.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
	High level of organization and meticulous attention to detail, especially regarding sensitive data.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritise effectively, especially under pressure during critical incidents impacting operations.
	Strong customer-service oriented approach, understanding the impact of IT on policyholders and internal stakeholders.


Preferred Certifications (Optional but highly desirable):


	CompTIA A+, Network+, Security+
	Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate, Microsoft 365 Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate, etc.
	Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)
	(Relevant Security Certifications like CISSP, CISM, or CompTIA CySA+).


Method of Application
Interested candidates who meet the above requirements are encouraged to send their updated Resume to: recruitment@fortisglobalinsurance.com using "Application: IT Administrator" as the subject of the email.

title: Record Management Officer / Operations Support Job at Workforce Group
content:
Workforce group is a leading provider of end-to-end, integrated and result focused Business and Human Resource solutions in Nigeria. From inception in 2004, we have helped clients across diverse industries and sectors such as Financial Services, Telecoms, Oil and Gas, Real Estate, Hospitality, Power, Entertainment, FMCG, etc., to achieve their strategic goals and objectives.

Workforce Group is a top business and HR consulting firm in Nigeria, offering advisory, outsourcing, recruitment and assessment, learning and development, market entry and technology services and solutions. Our reputation for excellence in service was built from over a decade of providing business and human resource consulting across several states in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Record Management Officer / Operations Support
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Human Resources

Job Summary


	Are you detail-oriented, organized, and passionate about operational excellence in HR? Join our team as a Record Management Officer / Operations Support, where you’ll play a vital role in maintaining accurate employee records, processing benefits, and ensuring seamless HR operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and organize both physical and electronic filing systems
	Maintain accurate recruitment, training, and onboarding documentation
	Implement and support the e-filing system
	Prepare and process employee benefits and regulatory remittances
	Maintain up-to-date training reports and support onboarding experiences
	Provide timely resolution and retrieval of HR-related documents
	Liaise with internal teams and external stakeholders (banks, NSITF, NHF, tax consultants).


Key Success Metrics


	100% accuracy in reports and memos
	100% prompt regulatory remittances processing
	Full compliance with HR operational procedures and benefit processing.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field
	1–3 years of experience in HR operations, record management, or administrative support
	Strong proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel
	Ability to work independently and handle confidential information with discretion
	Excellent organisational and file management skills (both physical and electronic)
	Familiarity with employee benefits processing and regulatory remittances (e.g., NSITF, NHF, PAYE)
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills
	Experience with HR documentation and onboarding support is an added advantage


What We’re Looking For:


	Strong interpersonal and communication skills
	Excellent organisational and documentation abilities
	Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel
	Detail-oriented, with a high level of accuracy
	A team player with a positive and proactive attitude
	Ability to handle confidential information with discretion.


Salary
N275,000 Monthly. (Net).

Note: If you're looking to grow your HR operations career in a dynamic, structured environment this role is for you!
